Reviews.Title: “Erick Jimenez @ Cocos Cabanas”
Reviews.Author: ErickJimenez
Reviews.Content: I have been a regular customer of Cocos Cabanas for the last 10 years. The location of this place is very convenient as you are next door to Playa del Carmen (5 min) and 20 mins from the airport, but in a more quite, unexpensive and sophisticated area. There are many advantges of staying at Cocos Cabanas, such as having privacy for resting, excellent food, private swimming pool and beach access just (600 ft away). My stays are usually 1 week long and almost every single year, flying out down there all the way from Stuttgart, Germany. The hosting provided by the owners (Silvia & Hlemut), who also run this business, is quite a different experience as you become a memeber of the family right away. Having dinner at Cocos is the best choice, as you can get international food at reasonable prices, and excelent service. My favorite one is the lobster wood-oven pizza, signature of Chef Helmut. In my last stay, I tried the Junior Suite with Ocean View, wich is brand new. I highly recommend Cocos Cabanas for couples, friends, families and business & relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “the most amazing place of the world !!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvia paola a
Reviews.Content: This place is awsame , The CABAÑAS are very PRETTY they are a mix of nature of the jungle and of the caribean sea with their turquies water and her with sand , the food is DELICIUS , THE PIZZA UM....... IT´S EXCELLENT . THE ATENTION IS KIND AND FUN , MS.Silvia IS AN EXCELLENT PERSON . I LOVE YOU MS.Silvia !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Path...and worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: JohnSarahDelaware_OH
Reviews.Content: Our first day of our trip to the Yucatan this year we're staying at Coco's Cabananas and loving it. This is a very small (6 cabanas ) hotel run by the on site owners Sylvia and Helmut. We're staying in the Purple Cabana and the newer Brown and Green cabanas also offer a kitchenette. I've included photos as they're absolutely beatiful. The food here is excellent and the service here has been exceptional. The bartentender Victor even climbed a palm tree so my wife could have fresh coconut.....now that's service. This place is not easy to find, it's approx. 3-4 miles north of Playa Del Carmen next to Petite Laffitte Resort and not directly on the beach. You'll have to walk approx. 60 yards to get to the beach. The best way to describe this place is cute and cozy. That's what makes it great. If you're looking for a nice quiet couples escape....this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Lovejoy2012
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived, expecting friendliness and welcoming we were treated gruffly, and asked to get out of the way - it didn't really improve after that, the first room they showed us opened directly onto the bar - with louvered doors it meant absolutely NO PRIVACY at all. We begged for a different room, and they did move us, but the palapas which look so photogenic are a bit shabby and the lighting is difficult. They charge an outrageous $3 for a bottle of water, and in general the place was so noisy, it's right next to a kind of garbage dump, and the beach isn't swimmable that is nearby... We didn't even try the restaurant, breakfast was minimal and the second morning they only had old, not really edible fruit with the cheap cereal. I had hoped for a really romantic sweet place, I heard it used to be like that but this place just feels run down....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous alternative to large resorts”
Reviews.Author: Scappi_11
Reviews.Content: Silvia and Helmut greet me like a family member. This charming small resort with a pool, a Swiss chef, 2 minutes to the beach with GREAT swimming....I continue to stay here because I can find nothing like it...and believe me, as a visitor to this beach for twenty years, I have been looking !

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: pmonty1
Reviews.Content: Coco Cabanas is an oasis in the midst of a stretch of much grander, more expensive hotels. The owners Silvia and Helmet are lovely people who make you feel welcome and have the best food in the area, however the rooms are BARE BONES with no safe, no mini fridge, no coffee maker, no tv or radio (an ipod docking radio would have been nice! esp with loud music coming from the bar outside my room, and from the hotel next door!). As for the price good for the area and the beach is beautiful, but I paid 1/3 of the price for similiar but better kept accomodations elsewhere. If they took the time to update the rooms with just a few little amenities I'd say it deserved a better rating. It's also far from the center of Playa Del Carmen so you need to get a taxi or bike (if you can find one!) to town. Go for the pizza!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, authentic, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jaeda P
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a night here on a drive down through Playa del Carmen. Although this is the city where Coco's is listed, it's definitely much further from town. If you are looking for something a little more rugged with an authentic 'hut' feel, this is your spot. We actually booked our stay for three nights, but decided on a whim to explore more of the city and stayed at a variety of places. I personally grew up going on camping trips, and with no air conditioning so I didn't mind our little hut (sans television and with one small and barely working air conditioner). There were board games and books available at the restaurant right outside, with cozy hammocks swinging next to a tiny pool. The beach was a short and easy walk, and the place next door let us use their beach chairs as long as we made a purchase at the bar (Coronas please)! Dinner was AMAZING with some of the yummiest margaritas I've had. Our spur change to leave early made us lose our money for the other two nights we booked. Sylvia and Helmut looked heartbroken that we were leaving and thought we didn't enjoy our stay. WE DID! We are just sort of spontaneous when it comes to vacations. They are lovely people and we thank them for their sincere hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Stay nearer the center of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Pulquero
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here for a few nights, I wished I had paid a bit more to stay nearer the town center. The setting is beautiful but it is in the middle of nowhere and you will end up paying alot in taxi fares if you want to do anything more than sit on the beach and eat in the hotel restaurant. The rooms are ok but a bit basic for the price - no safe, no phoneline, no tv, no clock/radio. Normally, I wouldn't care too much, but due to its remoteness you can't just pop out quickly for something. The shower/tap water is heavily chlorinated, and the drains can sometimes smell really horrible - if you want a shower, best use the swimming pool. There is also no 24-hour reception/guard, so any problems will have to wait until morning. There is a beach very close, but it is a bit dirty and rocky - just about ok for sunbathing but not much else. Downtown, the beaches are much better and is where we spent most of our time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Evening”
Reviews.Author: JohnRWestman
Reviews.Content: We couldn't pass up staying at CoCo's for one night on our trip to Cancun so we rented a car and took our friends along for a one night stay. They told us it was the highlight of their trip. I ordered pork chops in mushroom sauce and Helmut did an absolutely wonderful job preparing them. The sauce was marvelous. A nice relaxing evening. The road is being re done and will be fantastic when finished.

Reviews.Title: “Coco's is a cozy get-away, off the beaten path, with very personalized service.”
Reviews.Author: MexicoTraveler21
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to Coco's and they delivered again! Coco's owners, Sylvia and Helmut, do it right! The service is top-notch and very personalized...the food and drink are superb, the cabana's are private and cozy, the hammocks in the garden are perfect for an afternoon siesta and the beach is a one minute walk. If you want a cool place to stay off the beaten path and want to avoid the all-inclusive mega-resort -- come hang out at coco's

Reviews.Title: “Secluded and Simple”
Reviews.Author: kevin946
Reviews.Content: Coco's Cabanas was overall a very nice place to spend our vacation. The owners were very nice and helpful and the grounds were all very well kept and clean. The hammocks provided a great place to hang out and relax next to the pool. There was a lot of questions before our arrival about what to expect when we got there so I hope to clarify some of those here. There are 5 bungalows all very nice and well kept, however, one hot water heater for all 5. You need to time your showers when you're here if you want hot water. You have the choice of A/C, all have fans. We honestly just used the fans most of the time since it was cool enough in their winter. There were no safes in the rooms, which isn't a big deal but would have been nice. The location was nice and very close to the beach, but wasn't beachfront. You are tucked away behind another small hotel which is on the beach. You actually can't see the beach while inside the property. You to go out the entrance, turn right and there you will see the beach maybe 200' away. When arriving here, make sure you bring directions also because the cab drivers tend to not know where it is. It is off the highway a couple miles so be sure to arrive for the first time in the day so you can see all the signs pointing where to turn. The food there was great! Tasty pizzas of all types. It was a little pricy everywhere on the beach and around the area, so unless you plan on going into Playa del Carmen, Coco's is probably the best place to eat. It's the best deal around, although keep in mind there are only a couple places within walking distance. Overall, Coco's Cabanas was an amazing place to stay, especially when considering the cost, which also included breakfast!! I would definitely recommend staying here, maybe not for the honeymooners, but definitely for families who want to take over the whole place or anybody else just looking for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “My Tiny Slice of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: KARI3230
Reviews.Content: Once again I find myself here dreaming about another trip to Coco's - I have been there so many times I have lost count. Yep, I love it. I love absolutely everything about it. It is where my soul wants to go when it comes time to plan a vacation. Sometimes we even go twice in a year. There is nowhere else exactly like it. I have written many reviews and they are all true. There is a tug that I get whenever I think about the place, the family that owns it, the food, the wine, the laughter, the funny bird noises, the palms swaying, the tiny little pool shimmering in the sun, and so on.... There is too much to tell and words can't make up what you feel when you are there. All I can say is go.... and go with someone you love. You will come away loving them more than you did before your trip. Leave a seashell on your patio so I know you were there. 88 days and counting.....

Reviews.Title: “cozy small resort”
Reviews.Author: bcvic
Reviews.Content: Cocos Cabanas is a very small (5 cabanas) resort-family sort of feel, rather than resort feel. They are in the process of rebuilding the road now, so I can't give directions-other than to say I hope they signpost it, because it was next to impossible to find! Coming from Cancun, you turn at the lights by the Coca Coal/Cristal plant and follow the signs. There is building going on all around, and the beach is no longer remote-it's full of development. But still way quieter than Playa. The cabanas are nice-comfortable beds, great air conditioning (they don't all have a/c). There is no door between the room and the bathroom, though there are walls-not a lot of privacy, if that's a concern. The palapa roofs are nice, and tile floors are cool on the feet :) There is wi-fi, but only in the restaurant/bar area. Pool is nice to cool off in, and perfect for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: Monica4080
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned at Coco's Cabanas after reading some great reviews on Trip Advisor. We weren't let down! We were a little worried as we traveled to Coco's. You have to go back a very long, bumpy dirt road, but in the end we came out right by the beach and the best little resort in Playa. Helmut and Sylvia and their family make you feel right at home. Their cabanas are very nice and comfortable and the rest of Coco's is a haven for relaxation. Even though Coco's isn't right on the beach the walk to the beach is very short (about 1 minute) so we never minded. The restaurant was amazing and we ate there every night of our trip. Try the lobster pizza and the fresh fish fillet! I highly recommend Coco's, my husband and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great People Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: tlemcke
Reviews.Content: I confess we stayed a couple doors down but heard such great things about Coco's Cabanas that we had to go to the restaurant. Helmut and Sylvia own the place with only 5 rooms. The restaurant is nearly impossible to find. Going North from The Tides resort take the first left after you are past The Tides. You go between a couple buildings and are certain you are in the wrong place. After about 100 yards you see a sign and the restaurant. The food there is amazing. We had salmon pizza cooked in a wood fired oven and a great fish filet. This is a personal restaurant since the only people working there are Helmut and Sylvia. I counted 16 chairs but the most people we saw there in 4 trips was 5. Yes we went 4 times in a week.

Reviews.Title: “10 Years Later It Is Still Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: JohnRWestman
Reviews.Content: 10 years ago while walking on the beach we literally stumbled onto CoCo's Cabanas, met Helmut and his wife and their brand new baby in the pool. The cabanas were new then and we spent a couple of wonderful nights. Over the years we've wondered if the cabanas had survived the massive build up along the Riviera Maya and were happy to see a sign just north of Playa Del Carmen. We were between condo stops and decided to drive in and take a look. Absolutely charming!! Helmut met us like old friends. Rosie is as vivacious as ever and they now have two sons. Some changes: A wood fired pizza oven has been added - absolutely fantastic. Continental breakfast included in the morning with warm bread right out of that oven. And, if it is possible Helmut is an even greater chef than he was 10 years ago! If you are looking for a quiet place to relax in a lush tropical beach setting with great food and wonderful people this is your place. If you have no sense of adventure, prefer all inclusive, stay home and go to the Hilton for a week. j

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place In The Yucatan”
Reviews.Author: FairbanksWanderer
Reviews.Content: Have been to Cocos Cabanas 4 times now since 2005 and have had a great time every time. Helmut and Sylvia are so friendly and easy to talk with. They go out of they're way to make you feel welcome. The rooms are good with plenty of space, hot water, peace and quiet and are always clean. The food is as good as it gets. Helmut is a master chef and it really shows in his creations. Sylvia is so easy to talk with. You'll feel like you've known her for ever after a day. The pool is nice and the beach is a mere 50 yard stroll. I feel like I have family in Mexico now. Can't wait to visit with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - Had to do one more review - can't say enough”
Reviews.Author: KARI3230
Reviews.Content: Just to give you an idea of what type of travelers we are - we are a couple that started going here in our early 30's and now are in our early 40's. We are pretty much your average all American couple who loves this place. Safety - I have always felt very safe here. We started coming when there was literally nothing around it and nothing from the highway to the resort (approx 1.5 miles) I felt safe then and I still feel safe even though there is more development. Keep in mind that we have been there 12 times and never had a problem with safety. Like anywhere, you need to still be aware of your surroundings and take normal precautions. The owners - We love them. From the moment we met we have been treated with the best hospitality. They are very warm, friendly, and fun. They have hospitality down to a science. They know who wants to be left alone on a romantic dinner and who wants to joke around and be silly and will interact with you at your level. The food - out of this world good. The owners cook and are very good at what they do. In the beginning of our trips down here we tried all the food everywhere. In the last 3-4 years we have just eaten at the resort. It's better than anything in town, you know who is cooking it, there is enough variety with mexican, italian, american, etc. They have items on the menu that you can normally get at any time (snacks that include a great variety) and then there is the dinner menu that has great choices everyday. A continental breakfast is served everyday and normally includes warm breads and rolls served with butter, jam, and peanut butter, cereal, fruit, yogurt, coffee and juice. (we have always been satified with it) Nightlife - Depending on how many and who is staying at the resort this place can create its own little nightlife. There have been many nights that we have sat with other guests, enjoyed drinks and conversation and a lot of laughs. The resort is so small that you meet everyone staying there on the first day. There is music playing most of the time and this place takes on its own special magic at night with the lights and the weather and the mood. Hard to explain. You can also go into Playa del Carmen for more nightlife. We have done this after things wrapped up at the resort. Playa always has nightlife. Playa del Carmen - it is very close. Not close enough to walk. You can get a taxi but I would recommend a rental car. We have done this every year and like the freedom it offers. There is a little parking lot for guests only so there is always parking available very close to your room. The drive to town is about 10 minutes. There is something for everyone there. Its a cool little place that is growing rapidly. The beach - The beach by the resort has a great place to swim and lay out. You can walk in either direction and see some large resorts and some small resorts. Lots of interesting people...(lots of people is relative - not like Cancun or the beach right in Playa) When we starting going there was very few people on the beach. This has changed but its still not that busy. It still has the feel of Mexico. The beaches in town offer more people and of course beach bars for that cocktail on the water. The resort doesn't serve on the beach but you can take one with you..! You have made the mistake of asking the #1 fan of this place their opinion. I love this place. I dream about this place. I am like a 7 year old on Christmas Eve about this place. I have fallen in love with it and the people that own it. It is my tiny slice of paradise. Much has changed around it since we started going 12 years ago. But the magic that started it all is still alive and well.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TDsbeachbum
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay at Coco's Cabanas, and it is our new favorite getaway. We love the location and ambience. The owners are very gracious hosts, and Helmut is the best chef ever! Silvia's margaritas really set the mood, the beer is ice cold, and the layed back atmosphere melts all your stress away. With only 5 cabanas it is great for a romantic getaway, or go with friends and have the whole place to yourself! Located just 4 miles north of Playa we even walked the beach to town, which was really nice. Walk on the beach, take a dip in the pool, or take a nap in a hammock beneath the coconut palms. What could be more relaxing? Be sure to try the grilled shrimp and steak, or whole grouper! It is all delicious! They were expanding their bar & grill, and adding a pizza oven from Italy while we were there. We can hardly wait to go back and see the new additions.

Reviews.Title: “Hello Helmut and Sylvia”
Reviews.Author: sym666
Reviews.Content: I hve been in Coco's cabana in August. I spent 7 nights there and it was very very nice. I suggest everyone to go there. It's a very quite place and the hosts, Helmut and Sylvia are very kind. They prepare very yummy dishes and the place is wonderful, at 50 mt from an incredible beach. Simone

Reviews.Title: “Hello Helmet”
Reviews.Author: ray-n-stef
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to CoCo's at least 5 times and love it more each time. Helmet and Sylvia are the best. How's the little guy doing? Antonio is'nt it? The rooms, food, pool, service, location,and friendly atmosphere are beyond wonderful. Its a little rough getting there but the wait is well worth it. The visit makes you feel like you really are in Mexico- hospitality, good food, good drink (watch out for Presidente Brandy on the rocks),great people, and the other guest are having fun also which make the whole experience exiting. Whether you stay over night or just stop buy and visit for the day, you must go see Helmet and family. Ray &Stefanie Ambrosini Humboldt County California

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Bearfootin
Reviews.Content: Coco Cabanas was awesome! The owners were so friendly and tried to accomadate your every want or need. Helmet was a fabulaous cook! The place was so quaint,loved the small of the place being only five bunglows. And of course we were there in October which is mostly their low season, it was great for the two days we stayed. They were fun days on the beach and using the swimming pool as we had those days at the resort to ourselves at that time of year.The drinks and food was great!Want to getaway somewhere quiet with your partner this is it! Highley recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Apathetic Staff - revised”
Reviews.Author: docBoulder
Reviews.Content: Since writting my review last week,"Apathetic Staff", which I also sent to the management of Copal, I was contacted by a very nice and responsive customer service manager named Maria . I was very impressed by her interest and openess to my feedback, concerns and criticisms. Maria immediately called the owner and made on the spot changes to rectify the things I talked to her about and wrote about. Maria was genuinely interseted in making sure these conditions did not continue and I was assured they have been addressed and changed. Due to her eagerness to take care of the problems immediately, I will definetely be returning for a stay there in the fall as I really liked the place except for the problems I outlined. To me it is always a good sign when management is wanting to hear what the customers have to say. I can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely...”
Reviews.Author: ismenus
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here after reading the many fantastic reviews on trip advisor. It far exceeded anything we could have expected. The cabanas go beyond the normal cabana experience. They are very clean (and cleaned everyday) with a nice en suite toilet and shower. Attached to each cabana is a sweet little porch with a table, chairs, and a hammock which look over the gorgeously landscaped grounds. The whole place has a very intimate, friendly atmosphere, and we very much enjoyed the company of the other travelers drawn to this unique place. Helmut (minus Sylia who was in New York during our stay) and Margharite (who cleaned and made drinks) made us feel like old friends on a visit. Helmut cooked such fantastic food that we very often stayed in for dinner. All of that culminated on our second to last evening when he grilled up the Mahi Mahi and Tuna we had caught that day on a fishing trip. Helmut is the epitomy of a welcoming host. He was most accommodating; we loved his cheeky sense of humor and his very tasteful choice in music. The beach, which is only a very short walk from the cabanas, is beautiful and virtually deserted. Although there are spots of rocky coral, there are also plenty of clear blue sandy spots to enter the water and have a nice swim. You can easily hire a boat to take you out to the outer reef for better snorkeling. (We did this in Tulum and it was quite cheap.) Walking both north and south on the beach was nice (we walked all the way to Playa del Carmen once). To the north, there's a resort on the point which serves tasty appetizers and drinks (although Helmut's are much better), and to the south, before you hit Playa, there's a cool little cove where a lot of local people hang out. There's a pond here that warns visitors about crocodiles(!), though we never saw any. The whole area is gorgeous -- the water as turquoise as the pictures. If we didn't love going to new places so much, we'd return here again and again. It's everything you could want and more (unless you like horrible, big resorts with bland buffet food and loads of screaming people.) We are SO happy that we decided not to book some cookie cutter all-inclusive deal.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we Ever Imagined”
Reviews.Author: Huck-n-me
Reviews.Content: This was our first destination off the plane. I had imagined how lovely it would be BUT IT WAS MUCH MORE! We were greeted by Silvia and Helmut with such warmth and hospitality as we made our way down the path in the early evening. The restaurant & bar are so comfortable outside and Helmut is a great chef. The food is fresh and varied and they're happy to cater to your preferences. The cabanas are perfect. Beautifully designed circular structures with artistically created thatched roofs...nice little bathroom, simple and functional....Good ventilation. The hosts are so helpful and interesting,too. The spectacular beach is about a 2 minute walk from Coco's -- no crowds, just lovely fine sand. Sadly, alot of garbage has washed up: some of it is fairly interesting --- tiny mussels growing on plastic bottles; we found a note in a bottle!.... but what a pleasure to walk an hour and meet only 20 or so other folks enjoying this paradise... Coco's is superb. The driving directions one of the other reviewers gave are perfect....

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: OsoMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this quiet little gem for five nights in December. It is far from the Americanized Cancun and Playa del Carmen. The comfortable canbanas run around 60-70$ per night and include breakfast. It is not directly on the beach, but it is only a 1-minute walk away from some fabulous, mostly unspoiled Carribean beach. It is a bit rocky, but you can swim. The restaurant has a small but wonderful selection -- how can you go wrong with deliciously pepared fresh fish, well cooked by the regular staff. The owner, Sylvia is a true angel and delightful company. Cocos Cabanas is NOT north of Puerto Morelos, as one reviewer said, it is about 25 kilometers south on Xcalacoco beach near Punte Bete. It is roughly between mile 298 and 297 on Highway 307. As you drive South on the highway from Cancun, get in the left lane just after you pass the Capitan Lafitte resort turnoff. Soon you will see a red Coca-Cola / Cristal bottling plant sign on your left, and when you come to the TOPES (speedbumps in the road to slow you down), get in the extreme left lane and turn left at the SECOND opening. It's easy to turn left because the oncoming traffic has topes too! Follow the paved road to a rough dirt road and follow the signs. You won't be disappointed in this lovely setting, unless the party lifestyle of Cancun and Playa are what you came for. Good restaurants and snorkeling in Puerto Morelos, too, which is not far away.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bearwife
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is an undiscovered gem. The property is reached down a very bumpy unfinished road (turn left heading south on 307, just after the bottling plant), which is apparently how the local exclusive gated community and even more exclusive next door Ikal Del Mar resort like it. The hotel consists of beautifully landscaped grounds, several small one room palapas, each with its own shower/bathroom and a lot of storage space, a small lovely pool next to the dining area, and a small wonderful restaurant with a view of the pool and landscaping. There are places to sit or lie in hammocks everywhere. There is nice art everywhere too. The owner is incredibly sweet and warm and has wonderful English. There is a very well behaved yellow lab who is happy to accompany you on beach walks if invited. The restaurant food is great - don't miss the fabulous whole fried fish -- and breakfast is included in the price of your hotel room. The bar turns out the best margaritas I had in the Yucutan. The beach is rocky but beautiful, and at most 30 yards from the hotel. You can swim there if you like and it is an ideal place to take long romantic walks or energetic runs. We've attached some of our pictures. We absolutely loved it at Coco's Cabanas and would return anytime. This hotel is not on line and does not take credit cards, but it is worth it to call to make the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Coco's is great”
Reviews.Author: susan7142098
Reviews.Content: First, Coco's Cabanas is NOT in Tulum, where Trip Advisor groups it. But who cares? We liked the isolation at Punta Bete, which is just north of Playa del Carmen. The cabanas are perfect. Each is a different color and all are round, with palapa roofs. The round theme extends to the shower, open save for a slanted half-wall. This place is a perfect antidote to the giant all-inclusive resorts. Sadly, the proprietors are leaving soon. Coco's is a manifestation of their personalities, so who knows what it will be like in the future? For now, it's a great bargain and about as charming as a hotel can be. Add great food and fine tequila, with a beautiful garden to gaze at while you dine. Ah!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: KARI3230
Reviews.Content: One word-Perfect. You never want to leave. When you think of a place you miss like you would about a person you miss there is something special going on there. Since we came across this tiny slice of paradise years ago our marriage gets an annual dose of that romance you experience in the first few months of a relationship. When we travel back in the winter of 2007 this marriage will be 20 years old. Cocos Cabanas has had subtle changes through the years but it still holds the "magic" that it had on our first trip. Something tells me that may have something to do with the imagination and ideas that were brought to life by the owner, who continues to keep it just the way it should be. If the day ever comes that CoCo's is gone.... All I will need to do is close my eyes and it will be forever there in my memories. Until then, we will be back every year. Everybody should have a place like this to travel to and dream about afterwards until they are there again. Yes, one word, Perfect…

HotelInfo.Name: Coco's Cabanas
HotelInfo.Address: Xcalacoco | Riviera Maya, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
